a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Days off from work for vacations and holidays
Number of days off from full-time work in a year for vacations and national holidays
Note: In addition to vacations and holidays, workers had regular days off each week. Huberman and Minns estimated these numbers as
1 day each week from 1870–1913, 1.5 days from 1929–1950, and 2 days from 1960–2000.
